page_analysis.text_content:
Accessory structures site planning

Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures

A Combo garage /small pool cabana
(side by side)
• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
b. be no more than 12' high
c. comply with accessory-structure daylight
plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the side lot line so
that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.

Interior lot example

Combo garage /
small poo house

Rear yard

B Stand-alone pool cabana
Note: Site planning for accessory buildings differs from that for parking structures in
one way. A special allowance enables garages to be located in the rear/side yards
even when the lot is not deep enough to maintain the 75' minimum distance from the
front lot line. This does not apply to non-parking accessory structures.

• Structure is located in rear yard so it must:
a. be at least 75' from the front lot line
b. be no more than 12' high
c. comply with accessory-structure daylight
plane. (Figs 25 & 26 on p. 32)
• Structure is located right at the rear lot line so
that wall and the roof must be fire rated.
• Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink,
toilet, and shower and is greater than 200
sf, so it requires a CUP.

Interior lot example

Rear
Larger pool cabana
yard

C Office above garage
• Structure is located within the buildable
area, so it doesn't have to comply with
regulations for structures in the required
yards and it may be two stories high.
• Structure has 2 plumbing fixtures.
• Structure is new 2nd floor addition and
therefore subject to the Planning
Department's Individual Review (IR).

Corner lot example

Rear yard

above

Note: Because this

subject to Individual

visual_elements.description: Three site plan examples illustrating different accessory structure placements and associated regulations. Each example shows a lot with a main dwelling, front yard, rear yard, and interior-side yards, with one example also showing a street-side yard for a corner lot. Dimensions and setbacks are indicated. A key explains the symbols used.

Site plan for an 'Interior lot example' showing a 'Combo garage / small pool house' in the rear yard. The accessory structure is positioned near the interior-side yard line. A 'Min. 75'' setback is indicated from the front lot line to the rear yard structure. The main dwelling is in the front portion of the lot.

Site plan for an 'Interior lot example' showing a 'Larger pool cabana' in the rear yard. The accessory structure is positioned near the rear lot line and an interior-side yard line. A 'Min. 75'' setback is indicated from the front lot line to the rear yard structure. A '2-car attached garage' is shown connected to the main dwelling.

Site plan for a 'Corner lot example' showing an 'Office above garage' in the rear yard. The accessory structure is positioned near the rear lot line and a street-side yard line, with a '3' min.' setback from the street-side yard. The main dwelling is in the front portion of the lot.

Legend defining line types and shaded areas used in the site plan diagrams:
- Solid thick line: Curb
- Solid thin line: Lot line
- Shaded grey with horizontal lines: Sidewalk
- Dashed line: Required setbacks
- Light grey shaded area with dashed border: Buildable area
- Dark grey shaded area: Dwelling/parking
- Black shaded area: Accessory structure

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum distance from front lot line (A.a)
Minimum distance from front lot line (B.a)
Minimum setback from street-side yard (C diagram)

subheadings: A Combo garage /small pool cabana (side by side)
sections: Fig 24 Examples of site planning solutions for accessory structures

Note: Site planning for accessory buildings differs from that for parking structures in one way. A special allowance enables garages to be located in the rear/side yards even when the lot is not deep enough to maintain the 75' minimum distance from the front lot line. This does not apply to non-parking accessory structures.
Note: Because this structure is 2 stories, it must be located within the buildable area regardless of the distances from the lot lines and is subject to Individual Review (IR)

additional_notes: The word 'poo' in 'small poo house' under 'A Combo garage /small pool cabana' appears to be a typo and likely intended to be 'pool'.
The word 'Indvidual' in 'Planning Department's Indvidual Review (IR)' under 'C Office above garage' appears to be a typo and likely intended to be 'Individual'.
The word 'ditters' in the first 'Note' appears to be a typo and likely intended to be 'differs'.
The word 'tor' in the first 'Note' appears to be a typo and likely intended to be 'for'.
The word 'locted' in the second 'Note' appears to be a typo and likely intended to be 'located'.

Structure is located right at the side lot line
Structure is located in rear yard
Structure is located right at the rear lot line
Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink, toilet, and shower
Structure is located within the buildable area

wall and the roof must be fire rated.
be at least 75' from the front lot line
wall and the roof must be fire rated.
it doesn't have to comply with regulations for structures in the required yards
it may be two stories high.
therefore subject to the Planning Department's Individual Review (IR).
it must be located within the buildable area regardless of the distances from the lot lines

logical_relationships.expression: IF (Structure is located in rear yard) THEN (it must: a. be at least 75' from the front lot line AND b. be no more than 12' high AND c. comply with accessory-structure daylight plane.)
IF (Structure is located right at the side lot line) THEN (that wall and the roof must be fire rated.)
IF (Structure is located in rear yard) THEN (it must: a. be at least 75' from the front lot line AND b. be no more than 12' high AND c. comply with accessory-structure daylight plane.)
IF (Structure is located right at the rear lot line) THEN (that wall and the roof must be fire rated.)
IF (Structure has 3 plumbing fixtures— sink, toilet, and shower AND is greater than 200 sf) THEN (it requires a CUP.)
IF (Structure is located within the buildable area) THEN (it doesn't have to comply with regulations for structures in the required yards AND it may be two stories high.)
IF (Structure is new 2nd floor addition) THEN (therefore subject to the Planning Department's Individual Review (IR).)
IF (Because this structure is 2 stories) THEN (it must be located within the buildable area regardless of the distances from the lot lines AND is subject to Individual Review (IR))

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate conditions for 'A Combo garage /small pool cabana' based on its location in the rear yard.
Evaluate fire rating requirement if 'A Combo garage /small pool cabana' is at the side lot line.
Note plumbing fixture count for 'A Combo garage /small pool cabana'.
Evaluate conditions for 'B Stand-alone pool cabana' based on its location in the rear yard.
Evaluate fire rating requirement if 'B Stand-alone pool cabana' is at the rear lot line.
Determine if 'B Stand-alone pool cabana' requires a CUP based on plumbing fixtures and size.
Evaluate compliance requirements for 'C Office above garage' if located within the buildable area.
Note plumbing fixture count for 'C Office above garage'.
Determine if 'C Office above garage' is subject to Individual Review if it's a new 2nd floor addition.
Evaluate location and review requirements for a 2-story structure (general note).
